page.title: 04ECOLOGY (2)- DUNURE
page.content: Varied and interesting bird life can be found in area with gannets from colony on Ailsa Craig the star attraction.These magnificent birds can be seen plunging into the sea after fish,and stay all year except Dec/Jan. Fulmars frequent adjoining cliffs and a croaking Raven may be heard flying over village.A large Eider Duck raft usually off shore during winter.Great Northern Diver,Black Throated and Red Throated Diver are recorded.Close examination of marauding Gulls may reveal a Glaucous Gull,visitor from Norther Latitudes.Manx Shearwaters wheel past in large numbers usually late summer.Waders passing through include Whimbrel and Greenshank. Migrants from Scandinavia and Iceland attracted by hedgerow berries include Fieldfare and Redwing,the Northern Thrushes.
